lore: For a time, it was believed that Harpies stole gold and precious stones because they were attracted to shiny objects. A sailor discovered that in reality they feel indifference toward these objects, as he saw these creatures toss them into the sea.\n\nRarely do the victims of a Harpy Torturer lose their lives. These creatures rejoice in the suffering of others, cutting skin with their sharp claws and pecking at the soft parts. Before leaving, they rip the fingers off both hands from their victims.
menagerieDialog: (It appears content, but you're certain it will have a tantrum the moment you turn your back on it.)
(This creature is trying to pull out your hair to make an effigy. You're not sure whether to be flattered or revolted.)
(She has a terrible attitude, snapping at your other creatures whenever the opportunity presents itself.)
(Harpies are known for their deep hatred of humans. Fortunately for you, its loyalty is held steadfast by your magic.)
(It's flapping its wings and squawking even more obnoxiously than usual. It's probably sick. Good.)
name: Harpy Torturer
